title: At least two hospitalized after neighborhood shooting on Flint's east side
content:
UPDATE: Teen killed, two in critical condition after quadruple shooting
FLINT, MI - At least two people were sent to a hospital after a shooting on 2500 block of Churchill Avenue on Flint's east side.
Flint Police would not immediately confirm the number of people who were shot, but a neighbor who said she performed CPR on the victims said she saw two brothers lying in the street.
"I'd say they were both between 17 and 20," said Stephanie Anderson. "I heard shots and we called police. I started (CPR) on the one, but I noticed blood was coming out of his mouth, so I turned his head to the side."
Another woman, Anderson said, joined her in performing CPR on the young men until officials arrived. According to Anderson, it appeared one brother had been shot in his left kidney and the other in the head.
Anderson said she saw three men run out of a house on Churchill Ave.
Police were called to the scene at around 4:30 p.m., where they roped off the block, looking for the shooter and used a K-9 unit to investigate.
Police said the suspected shooter was found and detained.
